issues.text: In the limit, the Hilbert curve is a weird fractal that is simultaneously a curve and completely fills the square $`[0, 1] \times [0, 1]`. To those who haven't internalized analysis, a full informal proof requires touching on uniform convergence and Cauchy sequences, but I hope the gist is understandable to others. Given that correctness of the Hilbert curve needs such depth, it seemed like an informative test case to formalize in Lean, so we can see the difference in theory versus application.
